TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in LOC . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant sued the Government of GPE for monetary benefits on account of serious bodily injuries caused by a terrorist attack during his military service in the government ’s headquarters in GPE .
On DATE the ORG found in the applicant ’s favour and awarded him MONEY ( RUB ) in compensation . On DATE the judgment became final but the respondent authority delayed its enforcement .

On DATE ORG awarded the applicant an additional amount of RUB CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL in compensation for the inflation loss resulting from the enforcement delay ( “ indexation ” ) . That judgment became final on DATE .
On DATE the total sum of RUB ORG was credited to the applicant ’s bank account .

On DATE the ORG delivered the Burdov ( no . CARDINAL ) pilot judgment cited above . It ordered the respondent ORG to set up an effective domestic remedy which would secure adequate and sufficient redress for non - enforcement or delayed enforcement of domestic judgments . It also ordered GPE to grant adequate and sufficient redress , within DATE from the date on which the judgment became final , to all victims of non - payment or unreasonably delayed payment by ORG authorities of a judgment debt in their favour who had lodged their applications with the ORG before the delivery of the present judgment and whose applications had been communicated to the Government under Rule CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( b ) of the Rules of the ORG .

The present case was communicated to the Government on DATE . The ORG ’s proceedings in the case were thus adjourned until CARDINAL DATE pending the implementation of the pilot judgment ( see PERSON ( no . CARDINAL ) , cited above , § CARDINAL , and point CARDINAL of the operative part ) . The applicant was informed accordingly .

On DATE the Government confirmed that both court awards had been paid to the applicant on DATE and submitted a unilateral declaration aimed at resolving the issues raised by the application . The authorities acknowledged the excessive duration of the enforcement of the judgment of DATE in the applicant ’s favour and declared that they were ready to pay the applicant ex gratia the sum of MONEY ( ORG ) as just satisfaction .

On DATE the Government informed the ORG that in response to the pilot judgment CARDINAL federal laws had been enacted , introducing a new domestic remedy in respect of lengthy judicial proceedings and delayed enforcement of domestic judgments against the ORG . The laws entered into force on DATE ( “ the LAW ” , see part B below ) .
By letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant considered the ORG ’s remedial offer insufficient and declared his intention to avail himself of the new remedy .

On DATE ORG of GPE granted the applicant ’s claim for compensation under LAW . The court acknowledged a violation of his right to enforcement of the judgment of DATE within a reasonable time and ordered ORG of GPE to pay the applicant RUB MONEY ( ORG CARDINAL ) in compensation . The court took account of the enforcement delay , the nature of the award , its significance for the applicant , his state of health and the efforts made to obtain the payment . The court furthermore noted that the absence of domestic enforcement regulations during the relevant period and the complexity of the ORG ’s budgetary system were not the reasons for denying compensation . At the same time , the court held by reference to the ORG ’s case - law that the period of DATE from DATE during which the applicant ’s case was examined by ORG did not breach his right to a hearing within a reasonable time .
The judgment became final on DATE and the writ of execution was transmitted to the respondent authority on DATE .

By letter of CARDINAL DATE the Government withdrew their unilateral declaration of DATE , considering that the applicant was no longer a victim of the violation due to the latest judgment in his favour .
The court award was credited to the applicant ’s bank account on CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE ORG adopted a ORG , no . CARDINAL-ФЗ , “ On Compensation for Violation of the Right to a Trial within a Reasonable Time or the Right to Enforcement of a ORG within a Reasonable Time ” ( “ LAW ” ) . On DATE the ORG adopted LAW , no . CARDINAL-ФЗ , introducing a number of corresponding changes to the relevant federal laws . Both laws entered into force on DATE .

The Compensation Act entitles a party concerned ( “ an applicant ” ) to bring an action for compensation of the violation of his or her right to a trial within a reasonable time or of the right to enforcement within a reasonable time of a judgment establishing a debt to be recovered from the ORG budgets ( LAW , § CARDINAL ) . Such compensation can only be awarded if the alleged violation took place independently of the applicant ’s own actions except those taken in the circumstances of force majeure . A breach of the statutory time - limits for examination of the case does not amount per se to a violation of the right to a trial within a reasonable time or right to enforcement of a judgment within a reasonable time ( Section CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) . A compensation award is not dependent on the competent authorities’ fault ( Section CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) .
The compensation is awarded in monetary form ( LAW , § CARDINAL ) . The amount of the compensation should be determined by courts according to the applicant’

Section CARDINAL sets out the rules of jurisdiction and procedure . It states in particular that a claim for compensation on account of lengthy enforcement of a judgment may be lodged prior to the end of the procedure for enforcement of a judgment but not DATE after the expiry of the statutory time - limit for enforcement and not DATE after the termination of the procedure for enforcement .

A court decision granting compensation is subject to immediate enforcement ( LAW , § CARDINAL ) . It may be appealed against in accordance with the procedural legislation in force ( Section CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) . The costs of payment of compensation awards are included in the federal budget , in the budgets of federal entities and in local budgets ( Section CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) .

All individuals who have complained to ORG that their right to a trial within a reasonable time or to enforcement of a judgment within a reasonable time has been violated may claim compensation in domestic courts under the present Act within DATE of its entry into force , provided ORG has not ruled on the admissibility of the complaint ( LAW CARDINAL ) .
